"Puedes cifrar tus cuentas, los ajustes, las aplicaciones descargadas y sus datos, archivos multimedia y otros archivos. Después de cifrar el teléfono, siempre que hayas configurado una pantalla de bloqueo (es decir, un patrón, una contraseña o un PIN numérico), tendrás que desbloquear la pantalla para descifrar el teléfono cada vez que lo enciendas. También puedes descifrar el dispositivo restableciendo los datos de fábrica, pero se borrarán todos tus datos.
El proceso de cifrar tarda 1 hora o más. Debes iniciar el proceso con la batería cargada y mantener el teléfono enchufado. Si se interrumpe el proceso, perderás tus datos de forma total o parcial."
La operación de cifrado no se puede deshacer y, si la interrumpes, perderás datos. El cifrado puede tardar 1 hora o más y el teléfono se reinicia varias veces durante este proceso.
Debes establecer una contraseña o un PIN para la pantalla de bloqueo para usar el almacenamiento de credenciales.

"1，USB mass storage：phone as a U disk for file operation.
2，MTP：Phone as a U disk for file operation，operate file in phone at the same time. When computer OS is XP or below , it needs to install driver.
3，PTP：Use camera software to translate photos.When computer OS is XP or below , it needs to install driver.
4，USB debug：When connected , manage phone in computer with software such as LeHelper , 91 Helper and so on.
5，USB tethering：When connected , the computer can access internet through your phone. the U disk can not be installed when connecting."

¿Quieres detener la copia de seguridad de los datos del dispositivo (como las contraseñas de redes Wi-Fi y el historial de llamadas) y de las aplicaciones (por ejemplo, los ajustes y los archivos guardados) y borrar todas las copias de Google Drive?

"Haz una copia de seguridad automática de los datos del dispositivo (por ejemplo, contraseñas de redes Wi-Fi e historial de llamadas) y de los datos de las aplicaciones (por ejemplo, configuración y archivos guardados) en Google Drive.
Al activar la copia de seguridad automática, los datos del dispositivo y de las aplicaciones se guardan periódicamente en una carpeta privada de Google Drive. Los datos de las aplicaciones pueden ser cualquier tipo de información que guarden las aplicaciones según la configuración establecida por los distintos desarrolladores, incluidos ciertos datos que pueden ser confidenciales, como los de contactos, mensajes y fotos.
Los datos de la copia de seguridad no se tienen en cuenta al calcular el espacio de almacenamiento disponible en Google Drive. Los archivos grandes, o aquellos que los desarrolladores hayan excluido del servicio, no se incluirán en la copia de seguridad."

" "Lenovo User Experience Plan Privacy Policy " This privacy policy is subject to change without notice. We reserve the right to make changes to this privacy policy at any time. If we make a change to this privacy policy, we will make previous versions available so that you can see when changes occurred and what they are. This privacy policy is effective as of October 1, 2015. "What does this privacy policy cover? " This privacy policy explains how Lenovo Group Ltd. (“Lenovo,” “we,” or “us”) collects, uses, shares, retains, and protects information related to use of the User Experience Plan application (“Lenovo software” or “product”), which is subject to a license provided by the Lenovo User Experience Plan Terms ＆ Conditions. The User Experience Plan is designed to enhance Lenovo’s products and services and to improve the overall user experience. Specifically, the User Experience Plan allows: 1) Enhanced device software acceleration functions and personalized experiences; 2) Multi-faceted, personalized content recommendation services; and 3) Safer and more reliable software and service experiences. This privacy policy does not apply to information collected via other Lenovo applications or Lenovo’s websites. To learn about our website privacy practices, please visit the privacy policy statement linked to a particular Lenovo application or website. This privacy policy also does not apply to third-party software and services you install on or otherwise access through your Lenovo products or to any Lenovo software or services you use under an individual license separate from the Lenovo User Experience Plan Terms ＆ Conditions. "Multi-Users " Please note that secondary users and guest users of devices that support such multi-user capabilities may not have the same abilities to control settings, permissions and choices that the primary user or owner of the device may have. How does User Experience Plan collect and use information? If you choose to enable the User Experience Plan to enhance your device experience, Lenovo will collect certain additional information to improve our products and our customer service for your device. Lenovo will need to collect information on how you use Lenovo applications, including application usage statistics, device identification information and certain related data. We may use this information to analyze performance trends, develop upgrades for Lenovo experiences, help determine what new products and services to offer and improve the way that you access and use services from your Lenovo products. This additional information may also allow Lenovo to troubleshoot and diagnose problems with your device. Some Lenovo applications may also use third-party analytics tools to collect performance-related usage information. You can also choose whether you want to help improve Lenovo products or get enhanced device support by visiting the “Settings” in your device and turning certain options on or off. If you would no longer prefer to participate in the User Experience Plan, you may disable the application via “Settings” in your device. What types of third parties does Lenovo share information with? We limit sharing of information described in this privacy policy to certain types of third parties who help us use it for purposes you have agreed to. They include: • Service providers who provide hosting, data analysis and customer support functions to Lenovo. • Lenovo affiliates who help provide functionality for Lenovo software experiences and who help us use information as described in this privacy policy. • Wireless carriers and their affiliates and service providers, subject to your customer agreement with them. Please also note that, in special cases, we may need to share information without acquiring consent, such as when we believe in good faith that the law requires it, or to identify, contact or bring legal action against someone who may be violating our Terms of Use or may be violating Lenovo's or others’ rights or causing injury to or interference with Lenovo's or others’ property. "How does Lenovo store and protect information it has collected and shared? " We use standard technical and organizational safeguards when we transmit information from your Lenovo products to our servers, when we store data, and when we share it with third parties. Before we share information with a service provider, we enter contracts with them that restrict their use of information to authorized purposes and require them to use appropriate safeguards to protect the information that we have provided to them. However, please note that no data transmission or storage solution can ever be guaranteed to be invulnerable. As a result, while we have taken appropriate steps to protect your information, Lenovo cannot ensure or otherwise warrant the security of any information you provide to us and therefore you use our products and services at your own risk. When we collect information described in this privacy policy, we will retain it on our servers as long as necessary to support the Lenovo applications you are using and to comply with applicable laws and our own policies. If you stop using a Lenovo application, we will delete information uploaded to our servers as required by law and our own policies. We may transfer, use, and store information that the Lenovo User Experience Plan collects outside of the country it came from. These places may include jurisdictions whose privacy laws do not provide equivalent protection to such laws in your home country. However, whenever Lenovo handles personal information, regardless of where this occurs, we take appropriate steps to ensure that your information is treated securely and in accordance with the relevant Terms of Use, this Privacy Statement and all applicable laws and regulations. Please note that the actual geographic location of the server your data is on depends on where you’re located. For performance reasons, we try to locate the servers (or ‘Point of Presence’) close to the user base. So to the extent practical, users in the US would be using servers based in or near the US, users in China would be using servers in or near China, etc. "What about my child’s privacy?" The Lenovo User Experience Plan is intended for adults and children ages 13 and up who have permission to use them from their parents or legal guardians. We do not seek to collect information about children under the age of 13 and will delete any as soon as we discover it. We also encourage parents to actively supervise their children’s use of any mobile device. "How do I contact Lenovo?" For other questions or requests about the use of your information, including requests to opt out of the collection or use of certain kinds of information, please contact Lenovo at lnvinfo@lenovo.com.
